item.title: Bushes by the low kerb going into monks close over hang, 14th January
item.description:
This and other bushes going up the hill hang into the pavements making difficult to walk past and in the hard are hard to see ,These thorns on branches hurt and are dangerous as you can be to busy looking at the bad pavements when walking up and down this hill ,surly something should be done
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Monks Close, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 39 Willow Road, 14th January
item.description:
Ongoing Issue(3months): Bikes continue to be locked against the historic handpost. The road and pavement in this area are already narrow, which raises concerns about obstruction and poses a potential risk for school traffic. Would it be possible to install signage indicating "No Bicycle Parking" to help prevent issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Road, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: HGV parking on pavement overnight on residential road, 14th January
item.description:
HGV parking on pavement overnight and sometimes during the day on residential road. Vehicle is also parked close to a junction which is narrowed and causes problems with visibility. To big to be parked in a residential road in my opinion.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chastilian Road, Crayford, Dartford
